content.en: GNSS signal enhancement: Researchers have been investigating various techniques to mitigate the effects of multipath interference in high precision GNSS positioning. These techniques involve the use of algorithms that can robustly track weak GPS signals in multipath and jamming environments, implement the Space-Alternating Generalized Expectation Maximisation (SAGE) algorithm with reduced complexity, address the multipath resolution problem for direct sequence spread spectrum signals, and more. By integrating these algorithms into GNSS receivers, researchers aim to improve the accuracy and reliability of GPS satellite navigation applications.
content.da: GNSS-signalforbedring: Forskere har undersøgt forskellige teknikker til at afbøde virkningerne af multipath-interferens i højpræcisions GNSS-positionering. Disse teknikker involverer brugen af algoritmer, der robust kan spore svage GPS-signaler i miljøer med multipath og jamming, implementere Space-Alternating Generalized Expectation Maximisation (SAGE) algoritmen med reduceret kompleksitet, tage hånd om multipath-opløsningsproblemet for direkte sekvens-spredespektrum-signaler, og mere. Ved at integrere disse algoritmer i GNSS-modtagere, sigter forskerne mod at forbedre nøjagtigheden og pålideligheden af GPS-satellitnavigationsapplikationer.
